Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(2) Summary

The promise of APIs is to increase collaboration and innovation by making it easier for teams to reuse existing facilities. The reality of many API initiatives is that teams have difficulties identifying what APIs to build, and that teams also have difficulties finding and understanding APIs. The concept of API stories is similar to that of user stories as an informal description of capabilities of a software component, but the focus is on an application as the component user. API stories help producing teams to think with consumers and product value in mind, and allow consuming teams to understand the value that is being exposed through an API. Using API stories is a path to better API design and documentation because they make it easy to communicate about an API's value proposition.

(14) The Remarkable Value of APIs



API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(15) API Value = Potential × Usage

  • Designed as digital building blocks focusing on value
  • Published easily thereby evolving to the platform
  • Discovered in a catalog of all digital building blocks
  • Subscribed so that the building block can be used
  • Used to build new products
  • Improved to make the digital building block more valuable


API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(16) Openness and Automation

  • Create an open API platform that itself is open as well
    • Open API platform means any API can be added to it
    • Open API platform means the platform is built openly
  • Communicating value through the platform needs open formats
  • API value needs to be communicated through the toolchain


API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(17) API Value Chain



API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(18) Out-of-line or Inline?

  • OpenAPI has become a popular choice for API toolchains
    • It is technical in nature but has built-in extension capabilities
  • Out-of-line provides better decoupling from specific formats
  • Inline allows easier flow through toolchains and ecosystems
  • Combining both combines both advantages
    • Media types allow standalone representation and exchange
    • Extensions allow representation to be embedded into existing toolchains

Why? API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(20) Value-Oriented Canvases

  • A canvas is a strategic management template
  • It facilitates structured thinking and communications
  • It helps documenting the main value propositions


Why? API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(21) Existing API Canvases

  • Microservice Design Canvas
    • Matt McLarty and Irakli Nadareishvili, "Streamlined Microservice Design in Practice", December 2017 [https://dzone.com/articles/streamlined-microservice-design-in-practice]
    • James Higginbotham's version [https://launchany.com/microservice-design-canvas/]
    • Chris Richardson's version [https://chrisrichardson.net/post/microservices/general/2019/02/27/microservice-canvas.html]
  • Value Proposition Interface (VPI) Canvas
    • Amancio Bouza, "How to Use the Value Proposition Interface Canvas", September 2019 [https://www.amanciobouza.com/post/how-to-use-the-value-proposition-interface-canvas]
  • APIOps API Canvases
    • API Value Proposition and API Business Model Canvases [https://www.apiopscycles.com/resources/api-canvas-instructions]


Why? API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(22) Canvas Example 

{ "value-prop": 
  { "canvases": [
    { "canvas": {
        "href": "http://...",
        "type": "http://...",
        "name": "Document Browsing and Access",
        "description": "Allows access to folders and files ...",
        "tasks": "- Get folder contents ...",
        "dependencies": "- User authentication service ..."
}}]}}
  • canvas.json
value-prop:
  canvases:
    - canvas:
        href: 'http://...'
        type: 'http://...'
        name: Document Browsing and Access
        description: Allows access to folders and files ...
        tasks: '- Get folder contents ...'
        dependencies: '- User authentication service ...'
  • canvas.yaml

What? API Stories Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(24) User Stories

  • User stories are a type of boundary object
  • They facilitate sensemaking and communication
  • They help teams document their understanding of a system and its context
As a <role> I can <capability>, so that <receive benefit>.


What? API Stories Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(25) API Story Example 

{ "value-prop": 
  { "stories": [
    { "story": {
        "href": "http://...",
        "title": "Browsing Folder Structure",
        "as-a": "Creator of Folders and Files",
        "i-can": "Navigate freely through the folder structure",
        "so-that": "I can find and retrieve any file"
}}]}}
  • api-story.json
value-prop:
  stories:
    - story:
        href: 'http://...'
        title: Browsing Folder Structure
        as-a: Creator of Folders and Files
        i-can: Navigate freely through the folder structure
        so-that: I can find and retrieve any file
  • api-story.yaml

How? API Design Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(27) Designing the API

  • The canvas provides the constraints for the API
  • The stories provide the goals for the API
  • Developing stories into an API takes one additional step
    • This step depends on API style and technology


How? API Design Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(28) Product → Canvas → Story → API



How? API Design Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(29) Embedded Canvas and Story 

openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  version: 1.0.0
  title: Remarkable File System API
  description: Accessing folders and files for metadata and content
  x-api-value:
    canvases:
      - canvas:
          href: 'http://...'
    stories:
      - story:
          href: 'http://...'
paths:
  /{folder-path}:
    get:
      description: Returns the contents of a given folder
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Successful response
  • remarkable.yaml


How? API Design Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work

(32) API Consumption Matters

  • Digital transformation needs digital building blocks
  • Digital building blocks need to be useful and usable
  • Useful building blocks clearly document the value they bring
    • Usable building blocks expose the value as easily consumable APIs
  • Value is an integral part of all API marketing activities


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Making API-Based Collaboration Work
